text: [Music]
hi this is Seema and I am back with a
new lesson on expressions using the word
show now show is a very common word in
fact show is a verb now when I say verb
what do I mean I mean that the world
show means to present something that you
or anybody else can look upon so if I'm
showing you this pen you can look at it
because I'm showing it to you but the
interesting thing is that when I combine
the word show with other words the
meaning takes on a whole different level
so you get words or expressions which
change in its meaning when the word show
is combined with another word let's have
a look at what these expressions are the
first one is show off well when I use
the word show and the word off together
what does it imply this expression show
off means to do things to attract
attention oh there are so many things
that we can do to attract attention we
wear good clothes to attract attention
we do stupid or weird things to attract
attention we buy a really nice car to
attract attention so what we're really
doing is we are showing off so if I say
that I was showing off in my brand new
car I was doing nothing but attracting
attention
the next expression with the word show
is show up well what does it mean to
show up
well don't take the word up literally
but showing up means nothing but being
present being physically present I mean
or arriving at a particular place so
when you arrive at a party on time you
can say I showed up at the party on time
showing up as I said also means being
present physically present so I can say
that I showed up in class on time I
showed up in class before the teacher
are right and that's what showing up
means it is being physically present or
arriving at a particular place in a
particular point in time and the next
expression with the word show is show in
now what is the word show in mean a lot
of times when you go to a a restaurant
or you know a hotel maybe you are
probably meeting a group of people and
you know the waiter or or someone just
takes you to a group of people waiting
for you so showing in is nothing but
leading you to a place where people are
waiting for you so can I say that
showing in means being led or leading
someone to a group of waiting people or
simply being led to a certain place
where you are supposed to meet a group
of people now the other meaning of
showing could be to familiarize someone
with a particular place
so if you come into my apartment for the
first time I want to make you familiar
with my surroundings so I can say this
is my apartment come on let me show you
in so showing in has two meanings in two
different contexts one which means two
being led or leading someone to a group
of waiting people or to making someone
familiar with a particular place or
surroundings
now our next expression using the word
show is showdown well what does showdown
mean a showdown means nothing but
settling a dispute with a final
resolution you know a lot of times
people have a lot of fights a lot of
disputes and they don't come anywhere
near getting a resolution of some sort
so sometimes it is necessary to have a
showdown so when I say let's have a
showdown what I'm really saying is that
let's settle this matter once and for
all
let's have maybe you know a bit of a
debate over this and let's come to a
definite conclusion a definite
resolution so I could say something like
the boxers had a showdown on Friday
night so they've probably been rivals
you know boxing rivals for for weeks and
months maybe but on Friday night they
had a showdown which means that they
settled the matter as to who is the best
boxer so so a showdown is nothing but
settling a dispute and getting a final
resolution out of it the next expression
with the expression with the word show
is showcase now the word showcase can
have two two
meanings showcase if used as a verb if
it's used as a verb it would mean to
display or to exhibit so I can say that
the museum showcases its artifacts to
the general public so the museum
displays or exhibits its
artifacts or whatever they show to the
general public but if showcase were to
be a now the meaning is going to differ
slightly because a showcase as a noun is
nothing but a box with with sides of
glass that is used for display or that
is used to show things so when you have
a showcase you know a lot of us have a
showcase at home
a showcase is nothing but where you put
really pretty things in a box which has
you know sights made of glass wherein
you can show or you can exhibit certain
really pretty things as show pieces to
anyone who is entering your home so
showcase can be used as a verb which
means you are actually showing something
or displaying something or showcase can
be used as a noun
where and I can say that I have a very
pretty showcase in my house which means
I've got this really beautiful box or a
really beautiful you know a thing which
has sides of glass that can display a
lot of nice things to people who enter
my home and our next expression is show
times well show time is a very commonly
used
expression that most of you have
probably heard but what does it mean
Showtime is nothing but the start of an
important event so an important event
could be anything sometimes you know you
you're gonna go to for a movie and
that's a very important event because
you love watching movies so before the
start of a movie you say it's show time
sometimes you are maybe a corporate
person who who gives presentations so
before you give a presentation your boss
could say okay let's get ready it is
Showtime
so Showtime is nothing but the start of
an important event it marks the
beginning of presenting something that
is very important to you the next
expression is show stop well what is it
to show stop show stopped is nothing but
an event which leads to applause not as
an event it could be a performance or
anything that you do which is so
phenomenal that it leads to a lot of
applause so I can say that the rock
bands had a show-stopping performance at
the concert which actually means that it
was a performance or an event that led
to a lot of applause because the
performance or the event was phenomenal
it was really really good so that's what
show-stopping or show stop means now our
next expression is show business show
business is nothing but an industry or a
profession which deals with
movies plays music and everything that
is related to art so show business is
nothing but you know the pop music the
music industry as a whole movies and
plays and so when we know we always use
an expression like there is no business
as show business
so show business is actually a
profession or an industry well that
brings me to the end of this lesson on
expressions using the word show well I
hope you've enjoyed it and found it very
